description: A great dice mitigation game. The special powers and variable set up give the game legs. The dice as workers works surprisingly well. A classic style euro with simple ruleset and fast play time.

title: A Tight Race Against Time
description:
Marco Polo is one of my favorite Euros for a very strange reason.  Normally I am not a huge fan of super tight restrictions in a game, but for whatever reason, in this game I LOVE IT.  You will never have enough money, camels, or goods to accomplish all you want in a paltry 5 rounds.  Just when the perfect contract comes up, someone places their die there and takes others, now making your perfect contract cost more coins than you have.  Ouch.  

This push and pull and optimizing your path around the map makes for a delicious struggle.  If this doesn't sound fun, then give the new Marco Polo II a try.  It loosens the reigns so to speak but still retains the great core gameplay.

title: Great mix ...
description: Great mix of difficult choices within fairly deep overall strategy with an acceptable playtime.  After two plays, with two players, we're down around 1.5 hours.  Really looking forward to trying all the characters.

title: Pretty goo...
description: Pretty good! The character abilities are indeed bonkers, and leveraging the different city actions is neat--those two elements definitely make the game, as there isn't much there aside from that.

title: Pretty goo...
description: Pretty good streamlined Euro. Easy to learn and play and plenty of variety between plays. Not a ton of strategy or engine building - more just making the best with what you're dealt. The mechanics are streamlined and elegant but still managed to feel clunky at times.

title: After my f...
description:
After my first play, I could see this becoming a favourite game of mine. It worked well at 3. I think we got maybe a rule or two wrong? I have to read through the rule book again.

Might add that the rule book is not great for an on the fly reference.

title: Excellent ...
description: Excellent game with some of my favourite mechanisms - dice placement with mitigation, resource acquisition, multiple paths to victory. Best of all are the game breaking unique player powers. Fabulous design.

title: Dice place...
description: Dice placement and variable player powers.  Plays quickly (everyone is always saying "there's only one more round?"), so many ways to win, and is also different every time.  A great game!

title: The mechan...
description:
The mechanic balance very well between strategy and tactic. I love how you have to figure out how to exploit the map with what you have in your hand, build an efficiency engine and then deal with your dice results every turn. This game will not worn you out but bring you great joy and satisfaction after played.
+The Voyages of Marco Polo: The New Characters (2015)
+The Voyages of Marco Polo: The Secret Paths of Marco Polo (2018)

title: Great game...
description: Great game. So many different routes to explore and strategies to execute. Has a luck factor with the dice, but in theory this should balance out over the entire game. Kingsburg-killer.

title: Frustratin...
description:
Frustrating dice worker placement game that locks you in a box. The game is who can wriggle out of it the fastest.

For a game which is ostensibly about traveling, exploration, and trade the traveling action is maddeningly difficult to do.

title: The Voyage...
description: The Voyages of Marco Polo is the hallmark of asymmetric design. The game in general is tight, strategic, and full of indirect player interaction like any good Euro game. But the characters each offer a unique strategy through  their incredibly powerful abilities. Without the character tiles, Marco Polo would be quite ordinary, but their inclusion launched the game to stardom. Some characters are highly situational, while others are more generalist in nature, but each presents a new path to journey. Strategies are plentiful and balanced, and despite the presence of dice players are never handcuffed by a poor die roll. The game is very well paced, always seeming to end at its peak. I find myself thinking about this game long after each game session, and am perpetually awaiting my next play.

title: Fantastic ...
description: Fantastic dice roller than reminiscent of Alien Frontiers, but without the "take that" mechanic that you can employ. I think this would be a great way to get my SO into heavier and heavier euros.
